alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 4:23PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Lake and central Volusia Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 422 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Pittman to near DeLand to near Port Orange. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Daytona Beach, Port Orange, DeLand and New Smyrna Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County
